nodes.description: When transferring information between different security domains, implement content filtering mechanisms using multiple processes.

nodes.name: Information Flow Enforcement | Failed Content Transfer Prevention
nodes.description: When transferring information between different security domains, prevent the transfer of failed content to the receiving domain.

nodes.name: Information Flow Enforcement | Process Requirements for Information Transfer
Separation of Duties
nodes.description:
a. Identify and document [Assignment: organization-defined duties of individuals requiring separation]; and
b. Define system access authorizations to support separation of duties.

nodes.name: Least Privilege
nodes.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorized accesses for users (or processes acting on behalf of users) that are necessary to accomplish assigned organizational tasks.

nodes.name: Least Privilege | Authorize Access to Security Functions
nodes.description:
Authorize access for [Assignment: organization-defined individuals or roles] to:

(a) [Assignment: organization-defined security functions (deployed in hardware, software, and firmware)]; and
(b) [Assignment: organization-defined security-relevant information].

nodes.name: Least Privilege | Non-privileged Access for Nonsecurity Functions
nodes.description: Require that users of system accounts (or roles) with access to [Assignment: organization-defined security functions or security-relevant information] use non-privileged accounts or roles, when accessing nonsecurity functions.

nodes.name: Least Privilege | Network Access to Privileged Commands
nodes.description: Authorize network access to [Assignment: organization-defined privileged commands] only for [Assignment: organization-defined compelling operational needs] and document the rationale for such access in the security plan for the system.

nodes.name: Least Privilege | Separate Processing Domains
nodes.description: Provide separate processing domains to enable finer-grained allocation of user privileges.

nodes.name: Least Privilege | Privileged Accounts
nodes.description: Restrict privileged accounts on the system to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles].

nodes.name: Least Privilege | Privileged Access by Non-organizational Users
nodes.description: Prohibit privileged access to the system by non-organizational users.

nodes.name: Least Privilege | Review of User Privileges
nodes.description:
(a) Review [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] the privileges assigned to [Assignment: organization-defined roles or classes of users] to validate the need for such privileges; and
(b) Reassign or remove privileges, if necessary, to correctly reflect organizational mission and business needs.

nodes.name: Least Privilege | Privilege Levels for Code Execution
nodes.description: Prevent the following software from executing at higher privilege levels than users executing the software: [Assignment: organization-defined software].

nodes.name: Least Privilege | Log Use of Privileged Functions
nodes.description: Log the execution of privileged functions.

nodes.name: Least Privilege | Prohibit Non-privileged Users from Executing Privileged Functions
nodes.description: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

nodes.name: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
nodes.description:
a. Enforce a limit of [Assignment: organization-defined number] consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user during a [Assignment: organization-defined time period]; and
b. Automatically [Selection (one or more): lock the account or node for an [Assignment: organization-defined time period]; lock the account or node until released by an administrator; delay next logon prompt per [Assignment: organization-defined delay algorithm]; notify system administrator; take other [Assignment: organization-defined action]] when the maximum number of unsuccessful attempts is exceeded.

nodes.name: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts | Automatic Account Lock
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into AC-7.

nodes.name: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts | Purge or Wipe Mobile Device
nodes.description: Purge or wipe information from [Assignment: organization-defined mobile devices] based on [Assignment: organization-defined purging or wiping requirements and techniques] after [Assignment: organization-defined number] consecutive, unsuccessful device logon attempts.

nodes.name: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts | Biometric Attempt Limiting
nodes.description: Limit the number of unsuccessful biometric logon attempts to [Assignment: organization-defined number].

nodes.name: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts | Use of Alternate Authentication Factor
nodes.description:
(a) Allow the use of [Assignment: organization-defined authentication factors] that are different from the primary authentication factors after the number of organization-defined consecutive invalid logon attempts have been exceeded; and
(b) Enforce a limit of [Assignment: organization-defined number] consecutive invalid logon attempts through use of the alternative factors by a user during a [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

nodes.name: System Use Notification
Previous Logon Notification
nodes.description: Notify the user, upon successful logon to the system, of the date and time of the last logon.

nodes.name: Previous Logon Notification | Unsuccessful Logons
nodes.description: Notify the user, upon successful logon, of the number of unsuccessful logon attempts since the last successful logon.

nodes.name: Previous Logon Notification | Successful and Unsuccessful Logons
nodes.description: Notify the user, upon successful logon, of the number of [Selection: successful logons; unsuccessful logon attempts; both] during [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

nodes.name: Previous Logon Notification | Notification of Account Changes
nodes.description: Notify the user, upon successful logon, of changes to [Assignment: organization-defined security-related characteristics or parameters of the user���s account] during [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

nodes.name: Previous Logon Notification | Additional Logon Information
nodes.description: Notify the user, upon successful logon, of the following additional information: [Assignment: organization-defined additional information].

nodes.name: Concurrent Session Control
nodes.description: Limit the number of concurrent sessions for each [Assignment: organization-defined account and/or account type] to [Assignment: organization-defined number].

nodes.name: Device Lock
nodes.description:
a. Prevent further access to the system by [Selection (one or more): initiating a device lock after [Assignment: organization-defined time period] of inactivity; requiring the user to initiate a device lock before leaving the system unattended]; and
b. Retain the device lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.

nodes.name: Device Lock | Pattern-hiding Displays
nodes.description: Conceal, via the device lock, information previously visible on the display with a publicly viewable image.

nodes.name: Session Termination
nodes.description: Automatically terminate a user session after [Assignment: organization-defined conditions or trigger events requiring session disconnect].

nodes.name: Session Termination | User-initiated Logouts
nodes.description: Provide a logout capability for user-initiated communications sessions whenever authentication is used to gain access to [Assignment: organization-defined information resources].

nodes.name: Session Termination | Termination Message
nodes.description: Display an explicit logout message to users indicating the termination of authenticated communications sessions.

nodes.name: Session Termination | Timeout Warning Message
nodes.description: Display an explicit message to users indicating that the session will end in [Assignment: organization-defined time until end of session].

nodes.name: Supervision and Review ��� Access Control
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into AC-2, AU-6.

nodes.name: Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authentication
nodes.description:
a. Identify [Assignment: organization-defined user actions] that can be performed on the system without identification or authentication consistent with organizational mission and business functions; and
b. Document and provide supporting rationale in the security plan for the system, user actions not requiring identification or authentication.

nodes.name: Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authentication | Necessary Uses
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into AC-14.

nodes.name: Automated Marking
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into MP-3.

nodes.name: Security and Privacy Attributes
Security and Privacy Attributes | Dynamic Attribute Association
nodes.description: Dynamically associate security and privacy attributes with [Assignment: organization-defined subjects and objects] in accordance with the following security and privacy policies as information is created and combined: [Assignment: organization-defined security and privacy policies].

nodes.name: Security and Privacy Attributes | Attribute Value Changes by Authorized Individuals
nodes.description: Provide authorized individuals (or processes acting on behalf of individuals) the capability to define or change the value of associated security and privacy attributes.

nodes.name: Security and Privacy Attributes | Maintenance of Attribute Associations by System
nodes.description: Maintain the association and integrity of [Assignment: organization-defined security and privacy attributes] to [Assignment: organization-defined subjects and objects].

nodes.name: Security and Privacy Attributes | Association of Attributes by Authorized Individuals
nodes.description: Provide the capability to associate [Assignment: organization-defined security and privacy attributes] with [Assignment: organization-defined subjects and objects] by authorized individuals (or processes acting on behalf of individuals).

nodes.name: Security and Privacy Attributes | Attribute Displays on Objects to Be Output
nodes.description: Display security and privacy attributes in human-readable form on each object that the system transmits to output devices to identify [Assignment: organization-defined special dissemination, handling, or distribution instructions] using [Assignment: organization-defined human-readable, standard naming conventions].

nodes.name: Security and Privacy Attributes | Maintenance of Attribute Association
nodes.description: Require personnel to associate and maintain the association of [Assignment: organization-defined security and privacy attributes] with [Assignment: organization-defined subjects and objects] in accordance with [Assignment: organization-defined security and privacy policies].

nodes.name: Security and Privacy Attributes | Consistent Attribute Interpretation
nodes.description: Provide a consistent interpretation of security and privacy attributes transmitted between distributed system components.

nodes.name: Security and Privacy Attributes | Association Techniques and Technologies
nodes.description: Implement [Assignment: organization-defined techniques and technologies] in associating security and privacy attributes to information.

nodes.name: Security and Privacy Attributes | Attribute Reassignment ��� Regrading Mechanisms
nodes.description: Change security and privacy attributes associated with information only via regrading mechanisms validated using [Assignment: organization-defined techniques or procedures].

nodes.name: Security and Privacy Attributes | Attribute Configuration by Authorized Individuals
nodes.description: Provide authorized individuals the capability to define or change the type and value of security and privacy attributes available for association with subjects and objects.

nodes.name: Remote Access
nodes.description:
a. Establish and document usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for each type of remote access allowed; and
b. Authorize each type of remote access to the system prior to allowing such connections.

nodes.name: Remote Access | Monitoring and Control
nodes.description: Employ automated mechanisms to monitor and control remote access methods.

nodes.name: Remote Access | Protection of Confidentiality and Integrity Using Encryption
nodes.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality and integrity of remote access sessions.

nodes.name: Remote Access | Managed Access Control Points
nodes.description: Route remote accesses through authorized and managed network access control points.

nodes.name: Remote Access | Privileged Commands and Access
nodes.description:
(a) Authorize the execution of privileged commands and access to security-relevant information via remote access only in a format that provides assessable evidence and for the following needs: [Assignment: organization-defined needs]; and
(b) Document the rationale for remote access in the security plan for the system.

nodes.name: Remote Access | Monitoring for Unauthorized Connections
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SI-4.

nodes.name: Remote Access | Protection of Mechanism Information
nodes.description: Protect information about remote access mechanisms from unauthorized use and disclosure.

nodes.name: Remote Access | Additional Protection for Security Function Access
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into AC-3(10).

nodes.name: Remote Access | Disable Nonsecure Network Protocols
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CM-7.

nodes.name: Remote Access | Disconnect or Disable Access
nodes.description: Provide the capability to disconnect or disable remote access to the system within [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

nodes.name: Remote Access | Authenticate Remote Commands
nodes.description: Implement [Assignment: organization-defined mechanisms] to authenticate [Assignment: organization-defined remote commands].

nodes.name: Wireless Access
nodes.description:
a. Establish configuration requirements, connection requirements, and implementation guidance for each type of wireless access; and
b. Authorize each type of wireless access to the system prior to allowing such connections.

nodes.name: Wireless Access | Authentication and Encryption
nodes.description: Protect wireless access to the system using authentication of [Selection (one or more): users; devices] and encryption.

nodes.name: Wireless Access | Monitoring Unauthorized Connections
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SI-4.

nodes.name: Wireless Access | Disable Wireless Networking
nodes.description: Disable, when not intended for use, wireless networking capabilities embedded within system components prior to issuance and deployment.

nodes.name: Wireless Access | Restrict Configurations by Users
nodes.description: Identify and explicitly authorize users allowed to independently configure wireless networking capabilities.

nodes.name: Wireless Access | Antennas and Transmission Power Levels
nodes.description: Select radio antennas and calibrate transmission power levels to reduce the probability that signals from wireless access points can be received outside of organization-controlled boundaries.

nodes.name: Access Control for Mobile Devices
nodes.description:
a. Establish configuration requirements, connection requirements, and implementation guidance for organization-controlled mobile devices, to include when such devices are outside of controlled areas; and
b. Authorize the connection of mobile devices to organizational systems.

nodes.name: Access Control for Mobile Devices | Use of Writable and Portable Storage Devices
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into MP-7.

nodes.name: Access Control for Mobile Devices | Use of Personally Owned Portable Storage Devices
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into MP-7.

nodes.name: Access Control for Mobile Devices | Use of Portable Storage Devices with No Identifiable Owner
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into MP-7.

nodes.name: Access Control for Mobile Devices | Restrictions for Classified Information
nodes.description:
(a) Prohibit the use of unclassified mobile devices in facilities containing systems processing, storing, or transmitting classified information unless specifically permitted by the authorizing official; and
(b) Enforce the following restrictions on individuals permitted by the authorizing official to use unclassified mobile devices in facilities containing systems processing, storing, or transmitting classified information:

(1) Connection of unclassified mobile devices to classified systems is prohibited;
(2) Connection of unclassified mobile devices to unclassified systems requires approval from the authorizing official;
(3) Use of internal or external modems or wireless interfaces within the unclassified mobile devices is prohibited; and
(4) Unclassified mobile devices and the information stored on those devices are subject to random reviews and inspections by [Assignment: organization-defined security officials], and if classified inform
(c) Restrict the connection of classified mobile devices to classified systems in accordance with [Assignment: organization-defined security policies].

nodes.name: Access Control for Mobile Devices | Full Device or Container-based Encryption
nodes.description: Employ [Selection: full-device encryption; container-based encryption] to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information on [Assignment: organization-defined mobile devices].

nodes.name: Use of External Systems
nodes.description:
a. [Selection (one or more): Establish [Assignment: organization-defined terms and conditions]; Identify [Assignment: organization-defined controls asserted to be implemented on external systems]], consistent with the trust relationships established with other organizations owning, operating, and/or maintaining external systems, allowing authorized individuals to:

1. Access the system from external systems; and
2. Process, store, or transmit organization-controlled information using external systems; or
b. Prohibit the use of [Assignment: organizationally-defined types of external systems].

nodes.name: Use of External Systems | Limits on Authorized Use
nodes.description:
Permit authorized individuals to use an external system to access the system or to process, store, or transmit organization-controlled information only after:

(a) Verification of the implementation of controls on the external system as specified in the organization���s security and privacy policies and security and privacy plans; or
(b) Retention of approved system connection or processing agreements with the organizational entity hosting the external system.

nodes.name: Use of External Systems | Portable Storage Devices ��� Restricted Use
nodes.description: Restrict the use of organization-controlled portable storage devices by authorized individuals on external systems using [Assignment: organization-defined restrictions].

nodes.name: Use of External Systems | Non-organizationally Owned Systems ��� Restricted Use
nodes.description: Restrict the use of non-organizationally owned systems or system components to process, store, or transmit organizational information using [Assignment: organization-defined restrictions].

nodes.name: Use of External Systems | Network Accessible Storage Devices ��� Prohibited Use
nodes.description: Prohibit the use of [Assignment: organization-defined network accessible storage devices] in external systems.

nodes.name: Use of External Systems | Portable Storage Devices ��� Prohibited Use
nodes.description: Prohibit the use of organization-controlled portable storage devices by authorized individuals on external systems.

nodes.name: Information Sharing
nodes.description:
a. Enable authorized users to determine whether access authorizations assigned to a sharing partner match the information���s access and use restrictions for [Assignment: organization-defined information sharing circumstances where user discretion is required]; and
b. Employ [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms or manual processes] to assist users in making information sharing and collaboration decisions.

nodes.name: Information Sharing | Automated Decision Support
nodes.description: Employ [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms] to enforce information-sharing decisions by authorized users based on access authorizations of sharing partners and access restrictions on information to be shared.

nodes.name: Information Sharing | Information Search and Retrieval
nodes.description: Implement information search and retrieval services that enforce [Assignment: organization-defined information sharing restrictions].

nodes.name: Publicly Accessible Content
Data Mining Protection
nodes.description: Employ [Assignment: organization-defined data mining prevention and detection techniques] for [Assignment: organization-defined data storage objects] to detect and protect against unauthorized data mining.

nodes.name: Access Control Decisions
nodes.description: [Selection: Establish procedures; Implement mechanisms] to ensure [Assignment: organization-defined access control decisions] are applied to each access request prior to access enforcement.

nodes.name: Access Control Decisions | Transmit Access Authorization Information
nodes.description: Transmit [Assignment: organization-defined access authorization information] using [Assignment: organization-defined controls] to [Assignment: organization-defined systems] that enforce access control decisions.

nodes.name: Access Control Decisions | No User or Process Identity
nodes.description: Enforce access control decisions based on [Assignment: organization-defined security or privacy attributes] that do not include the identity of the user or process acting on behalf of the user.

nodes.name: Reference Monitor
nodes.description: Implement a reference monitor for [Assignment: organization-defined access control policies] that is tamperproof, always invoked, and small enough to be subject to analysis and testing, the completeness of which can be assured.

nodes.name: Policy and Procedures
nodes.description:
a. Develop, document, and disseminate to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]:

1. [Selection (one or more): Organization-level; Mission/business process-level; System-level] awareness and training policy that:

(a) Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
(b) Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
2. Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the awareness and training policy and the associated awareness and training controls;
b. Designate an [Assignment: organization-defined official] to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the awareness and training policy and procedures; and
c. Review and update the current awareness and training:

1. Policy [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events]; and
2. Procedures [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events].

nodes.name: Literacy Training and Awareness
Literacy Training and Awareness | Practical Exercises
nodes.description: Provide practical exercises in literacy training that simulate events and incidents.

nodes.name: Literacy Training and Awareness | Insider Threat
nodes.description: Provide literacy training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat.

nodes.name: Literacy Training and Awareness | Social Engineering and Mining
nodes.description: Provide literacy training on recognizing and reporting potential and actual instances of social engineering and social mining.

nodes.name: Literacy Training and Awareness | Suspicious Communications and Anomalous System Behavior
nodes.description: Provide literacy training on recognizing suspicious communications and anomalous behavior in organizational systems using [Assignment: organization-defined indicators of malicious code].

nodes.name: Literacy Training and Awareness | Advanced Persistent Threat
nodes.description: Provide literacy training on the advanced persistent threat.

nodes.name: Literacy Training and Awareness | Cyber Threat Environment
nodes.description:
(a) Provide literacy training on the cyber threat environment; and
(b) Reflect current cyber threat information in system operations.

nodes.name: Role-based Training
nodes.description:
a. Provide role-based security and privacy training to personnel with the following roles and responsibilities: [Assignment: organization-defined roles and responsibilities]:

1. Before authorizing access to the system, information, or performing assigned duties, and [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] thereafter; and
2. When required by system changes;
b. Update role-based training content [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events]; and
c. Incorporate lessons learned from internal or external security incidents or breaches into role-based training.

nodes.name: Role-based Training | Environmental Controls
nodes.description: Provide [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] with initial and [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] training in the employment and operation of environmental controls.

nodes.name: Role-based Training | Physical Security Controls
nodes.description: Provide [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] with initial and [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] training in the employment and operation of physical security controls.

nodes.name: Role-based Training | Practical Exercises
nodes.description: Provide practical exercises in security and privacy training that reinforce training objectives.

nodes.name: Role-based Training | Suspicious Communications and Anomalous System Behavior
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into AT-2(4).

nodes.name: Role-based Training | Processing Personally Identifiable Information
nodes.description: Provide [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] with initial and [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] training in the employment and operation of personally identifiable information processing and transparency controls.

nodes.name: Training Records
nodes.description:
a. Document and monitor information security and privacy training activities, including security and privacy awareness training and specific role-based security and privacy training; and
b. Retain individual training records for [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

nodes.name: Contacts with Security Groups and Associations
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into PM-15.

nodes.name: Training Feedback
nodes.description: Provide feedback on organizational training results to the following personnel [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]: [Assignment: organization-defined personnel].

nodes.name: Policy and Procedures
nodes.description:
a. Develop, document, and disseminate to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]:

1. [Selection (one or more): Organization-level; Mission/business process-level; System-level] audit and accountability policy that:

(a) Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
(b) Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
2. Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the audit and accountability policy and the associated audit and accountability controls;
b. Designate an [Assignment: organization-defined official] to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the audit and accountability policy and procedures; and
c. Review and update the current audit and accountability:

1. Policy [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events]; and
2. Procedures [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events].

nodes.name: Event Logging
Event Logging | Compilation of Audit Records from Multiple Sources
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into AU-12.

nodes.name: Event Logging | Selection of Audit Events by Component
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into AU-12.

nodes.name: Event Logging | Reviews and Updates
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into AU-2.

nodes.name: Event Logging | Privileged Functions
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into AC-6(9).

nodes.name: Content of Audit Records
Content of Audit Records | Additional Audit Information
nodes.description: Generate audit records containing the following additional information: [Assignment: organization-defined additional information].

nodes.name: Content of Audit Records | Centralized Management of Planned Audit Record Content
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into PL-9.

nodes.name: Content of Audit Records | Limit Personally Identifiable Information Elements
nodes.description: Limit personally identifiable information contained in audit records to the following elements identified in the privacy risk assessment: [Assignment: organization-defined elements].

nodes.name: Audit Log Storage Capacity
nodes.description: Allocate audit log storage capacity to accommodate [Assignment: organization-defined audit log retention requirements].

nodes.name: Audit Log Storage Capacity | Transfer to Alternate Storage
nodes.description: Transfer audit logs [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] to a different system, system component, or media other than the system or system component conducting the logging.

nodes.name: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures
nodes.description:
a. Alert [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] in the event of an audit logging process failure; and
b. Take the following additional actions: [Assignment: organization-defined additional actions].

nodes.name: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures | Storage Capacity Warning
nodes.description: Provide a warning to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel, roles, and/or locations] within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] when allocated audit log storage volume reaches [Assignment: organization-defined percentage] of repository maximum audit log storage capacity.

nodes.name: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures | Real-time Alerts
nodes.description: Provide an alert within [Assignment: organization-defined real-time period] to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel, roles, and/or locations] when the following audit failure events occur: [Assignment: organization-defined audit logging failure events requiring real-time alerts].

nodes.name: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures | Configurable Traffic Volume Thresholds
nodes.description: Enforce configurable network communications traffic volume thresholds reflecting limits on audit log storage capacity and [Selection: reject; delay] network traffic above those thresholds.

nodes.name: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures | Shutdown on Failure
nodes.description: Invoke a [Selection: full system shutdown; partial system shutdown; degraded operational mode with limited mission or business functionality available] in the event of [Assignment: organization-defined audit logging failures], unless an alternate audit logging capability exists.

nodes.name: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures | Alternate Audit Logging Capability
nodes.description: Provide an alternate audit logging capability in the event of a failure in primary audit logging capability that implements [Assignment: organization-defined alternate audit logging functionality].

nodes.name: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting
Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Automated Process Integration
nodes.description: Integrate audit record review, analysis, and reporting processes using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nodes.name: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Automated Security Alerts
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SI-4.

nodes.name: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Correlate Audit Record Repositories
nodes.description: Analyze and correlate audit records across different repositories to gain organization-wide situational awareness.

nodes.name: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Central Review and Analysis
nodes.description: Provide and implement the capability to centrally review and analyze audit records from multiple components within the system.

nodes.name: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Integrated Analysis of Audit Records
nodes.description: Integrate analysis of audit records with analysis of [Selection (one or more): vulnerability scanning information; performance data; system monitoring information; [Assignment: organization-defined data/information collected from other sources]] to further enhance the ability to identify inappropriate or unusual activity.

nodes.name: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Correlation with Physical Monitoring
nodes.description: Correlate information from audit records with information obtained from monitoring physical access to further enhance the ability to identify suspicious, inappropriate, unusual, or malevolent activity.

nodes.name: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Permitted Actions
nodes.description: Specify the permitted actions for each [Selection (one or more): system process; role; user] associated with the review, analysis, and reporting of audit record information.

nodes.name: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Full Text Analysis of Privileged Commands
nodes.description: Perform a full text analysis of logged privileged commands in a physically distinct component or subsystem of the system, or other system that is dedicated to that analysis.

nodes.name: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Correlation with Information from Nontechnical Sources
nodes.description: Correlate information from nontechnical sources with audit record information to enhance organization-wide situational awareness.

nodes.name: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Audit Level Adjustment
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into AU-6.

nodes.name: Audit Record Reduction and Report Generation
nodes.description:
Provide and implement an audit record reduction and report generation capability that:

a. Supports on-demand audit record review, analysis, and reporting requirements and after-the-fact investigations of incidents; and
b. Does not alter the original content or time ordering of audit records.

nodes.name: Audit Record Reduction and Report Generation | Automatic Processing
nodes.description: Provide and implement the capability to process, sort, and search audit records for events of interest based on the following content: [Assignment: organization-defined fields within audit records].

nodes.name: Audit Record Reduction and Report Generation | Automatic Sort and Search
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into AU-7(1).

nodes.name: Time Stamps
nodes.description:
a. Use internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records; and
b. Record time stamps for audit records that meet [Assignment: organization-defined granularity of time measurement] and that use Coordinated Universal Time, have a fixed local time offset from Coordinated Universal Time, or that include the local time offset as part of the time stamp.

nodes.name: Time Stamps | Synchronization with Authoritative Time Source
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-45(1).

nodes.name: Time Stamps | Secondary Authoritative Time Source
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-45(2).

nodes.name: Protection of Audit Information
nodes.description:
a. Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion; and
b. Alert [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] upon detection of unauthorized access, modification, or deletion of audit information.

nodes.name: Protection of Audit Information | Hardware Write-once Media
nodes.description: Write audit trails to hardware-enforced, write-once media.

nodes.name: Protection of Audit Information | Store on Separate Physical Systems or Components
nodes.description: Store audit records [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] in a repository that is part of a physically different system or system component than the system or component being audited.

nodes.name: Protection of Audit Information | Cryptographic Protection
nodes.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the integrity of audit information and audit tools.

nodes.name: Protection of Audit Information | Access by Subset of Privileged Users
nodes.description: Authorize access to management of audit logging functionality to only [Assignment: organization-defined subset of privileged users or roles].

nodes.name: Protection of Audit Information | Dual Authorization
nodes.description: Enforce dual authorization for [Selection (one or more): movement; deletion] of [Assignment: organization-defined audit information].

nodes.name: Protection of Audit Information | Read-only Access
nodes.description: Authorize read-only access to audit information to [Assignment: organization-defined subset of privileged users or roles].

nodes.name: Protection of Audit Information | Store on Component with Different Operating System
nodes.description: Store audit information on a component running a different operating system than the system or component being audited.

nodes.name: Non-repudiation
nodes.description: Provide irrefutable evidence that an individual (or process acting on behalf of an individual) has performed [Assignment: organization-defined actions to be covered by non-repudiation].

nodes.name: Non-repudiation | Association of Identities
nodes.description:
(a) Bind the identity of the information producer with the information to [Assignment: organization-defined strength of binding]; and
(b) Provide the means for authorized individuals to determine the identity of the producer of the information.

nodes.name: Non-repudiation | Validate Binding of Information Producer Identity
nodes.description:
(a) Validate the binding of the information producer identity to the information at [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]; and
(b) Perform [Assignment: organization-defined actions] in the event of a validation error.

nodes.name: Non-repudiation | Chain of Custody
nodes.description: Maintain reviewer or releaser credentials within the established chain of custody for information reviewed or released.

nodes.name: Non-repudiation | Validate Binding of Information Reviewer Identity
nodes.description:
(a) Validate the binding of the information reviewer identity to the information at the transfer or release points prior to release or transfer between [Assignment: organization-defined security domains]; and
(b) Perform [Assignment: organization-defined actions] in the event of a validation error.

nodes.name: Non-repudiation | Digital Signatures
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SI-7.

nodes.name: Audit Record Retention
nodes.description: Retain audit records for [Assignment: organization-defined time period consistent with records retention policy] to provide support for after-the-fact investigations of incidents and to meet regulatory and organizational information retention requirements.

nodes.name: Audit Record Retention | Long-term Retrieval Capability
nodes.description: Employ [Assignment: organization-defined measures] to ensure that long-term audit records generated by the system can be retrieved.

nodes.name: Audit Record Generation
Audit Record Generation | System-wide and Time-correlated Audit Trail
nodes.description: Compile audit records from [Assignment: organization-defined system components] into a system-wide (logical or physical) audit trail that is time-correlated to within [Assignment: organization-defined level of tolerance for the relationship between time stamps of individual records in the audit trail].

nodes.name: Audit Record Generation | Standardized Formats
nodes.description: Produce a system-wide (logical or physical) audit trail composed of audit records in a standardized format.

nodes.name: Audit Record Generation | Changes by Authorized Individuals
nodes.description: Provide and implement the capability for [Assignment: organization-defined individuals or roles] to change the logging to be performed on [Assignment: organization-defined system components] based on [Assignment: organization-defined selectable event criteria] within [Assignment: organization-defined time thresholds].

nodes.name: Audit Record Generation | Query Parameter Audits of Personally Identifiable Information
nodes.description: Provide and implement the capability for auditing the parameters of user query events for data sets containing personally identifiable information.

nodes.name: Monitoring for Information Disclosure
nodes.description:
a. Monitor [Assignment: organization-defined open-source information and/or information sites]
                  [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] for evidence of unauthorized disclosure of organizational information; and
b. If an information disclosure is discovered:

1. Notify [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]; and
2. Take the following additional actions: [Assignment: organization-defined additional actions].

nodes.name: Monitoring for Information Disclosure | Use of Automated Tools
nodes.description: Monitor open-source information and information sites using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nodes.name: Monitoring for Information Disclosure | Review of Monitored Sites
nodes.description: Review the list of open-source information sites being monitored [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

nodes.name: Monitoring for Information Disclosure | Unauthorized Replication of Information
nodes.description: Employ discovery techniques, processes, and tools to determine if external entities are replicating organizational information in an unauthorized manner.

nodes.name: Session Audit
nodes.description:
a. Provide and implement the capability for [Assignment: organization-defined users or roles] to [Selection (one or more): record; view; hear; log] the content of a user session under [Assignment: organization-defined circumstances]; and
b. Develop, integrate, and use session auditing activities in consultation with legal counsel and in accordance with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines.

nodes.name: Session Audit | System Start-up
nodes.description: Initiate session audits automatically at system start-up.

nodes.name: Session Audit | Capture and Record Content
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into AU-14.

nodes.name: Session Audit | Remote Viewing and Listening
nodes.description: Provide and implement the capability for authorized users to remotely view and hear content related to an established user session in real time.

nodes.name: Alternate Audit Logging Capability
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into .

nodes.name: Cross-organizational Audit Logging
nodes.description: Employ [Assignment: organization-defined methods] for coordinating [Assignment: organization-defined audit information] among external organizations when audit information is transmitted across organizational boundaries.

nodes.name: Cross-organizational Audit Logging | Identity Preservation
nodes.description: Preserve the identity of individuals in cross-organizational audit trails.

nodes.name: Cross-organizational Audit Logging | Sharing of Audit Information
nodes.description: Provide cross-organizational audit information to [Assignment: organization-defined organizations] based on [Assignment: organization-defined cross-organizational sharing agreements].

nodes.name: Cross-organizational Audit Logging | Disassociability
nodes.description: Implement [Assignment: organization-defined measures] to disassociate individuals from audit information transmitted across organizational boundaries.

nodes.name: Policy and Procedures
nodes.description:
a. Develop, document, and disseminate to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]:

1. [Selection (one or more): Organization-level; Mission/business process-level; System-level] assessment, authorization, and monitoring policy that:

(a) Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
(b) Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
2. Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the assessment, authorization, and monitoring policy and the associated assessment, authorization, and monitoring controls;
b. Designate an [Assignment: organization-defined official] to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the assessment, authorization, and monitoring policy and procedures; and
c. Review and update the current assessment, authorization, and monitoring:

1. Policy [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events]; and
2. Procedures [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events].

nodes.name: Control Assessments
Control Assessments | Independent Assessors
nodes.description: Employ independent assessors or assessment teams to conduct control assessments.

nodes.name: Control Assessments | Specialized Assessments
nodes.description: Include as part of control assessments, [Assignment: organization-defined frequency], [Selection: announced; unannounced], [Selection (one or more): in-depth monitoring; security instrumentation; automated security test cases; vulnerability scanning; malicious user testing; insider threat assessment; performance and load testing; data leakage or data loss assessment; [Assignment: organization-defined other forms of assessment]].

nodes.name: Control Assessments | Leveraging Results from External Organizations
nodes.description: Leverage the results of control assessments performed by [Assignment: organization-defined external organization] on [Assignment: organization-defined system] when the assessment meets [Assignment: organization-defined requirements].

nodes.name: Information Exchange
Information Exchange | Unclassified National Security System Connections
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-7(25).

nodes.name: Information Exchange | Classified National Security System Connections
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-7(26).

nodes.name: Information Exchange | Unclassified Non-national Security System Connections
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-7(27).

nodes.name: Information Exchange | Connections to Public Networks
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-7(28).

nodes.name: Information Exchange | Restrictions on External System Connections
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-7(5).

nodes.name: Information Exchange | Transfer Authorizations
nodes.description: Verify that individuals or systems transferring data between interconnecting systems have the requisite authorizations (i.e., write permissions or privileges) prior to accepting such data.

nodes.name: Information Exchange | Transitive Information Exchanges
nodes.description:
(a) Identify transitive (downstream) information exchanges with other systems through the systems identified in CA-3a; and
(b) Take measures to ensure that transitive (downstream) information exchanges cease when the controls on identified transitive (downstream) systems cannot be verified or validated.

nodes.name: Security Certification
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CA-2.

nodes.name: Plan of Action and Milestones
nodes.description:
a. Develop a plan of action and milestones for the system to document the planned remediation actions of the organization to correct weaknesses or deficiencies noted during the assessment of the controls and to reduce or eliminate known vulnerabilities in the system; and
b. Update existing plan of action and milestones [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] based on the findings from control assessments, independent audits or reviews, and continuous monitoring activities.

nodes.name: Plan of Action and Milestones | Automation Support for Accuracy and Currency
nodes.description: Ensure the accuracy, currency, and availability of the plan of action and milestones for the system using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nodes.name: Authorization
Authorization | Joint Authorization ��� Intra-organization
nodes.description: Employ a joint authorization process for the system that includes multiple authorizing officials from the same organization conducting the authorization.

nodes.name: Authorization | Joint Authorization ��� Inter-organization
nodes.description: Employ a joint authorization process for the system that includes multiple authorizing officials with at least one authorizing official from an organization external to the organization conducting the authorization.

nodes.name: Continuous Monitoring
Continuous Monitoring | Independent Assessment
nodes.description: Employ independent assessors or assessment teams to monitor the controls in the system on an ongoing basis.

nodes.name: Continuous Monitoring | Types of Assessments
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CA-2.

nodes.name: Continuous Monitoring | Trend Analyses
nodes.description: Employ trend analyses to determine if control implementations, the frequency of continuous monitoring activities, and the types of activities used in the continuous monitoring process need to be modified based on empirical data.

nodes.name: Continuous Monitoring | Risk Monitoring
nodes.description:
Ensure risk monitoring is an integral part of the continuous monitoring strategy that includes the following:

(a) Effectiveness monitoring;
(b) Compliance monitoring; and
(c) Change monitoring.

nodes.name: Continuous Monitoring | Consistency Analysis
nodes.description: Employ the following actions to validate that policies are established and implemented controls are operating in a consistent manner: [Assignment: organization-defined actions].

nodes.name: Continuous Monitoring | Automation Support for Monitoring
nodes.description: Ensure the accuracy, currency, and availability of monitoring results for the system using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nodes.name: Penetration Testing
nodes.description: Conduct penetration testing [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] on [Assignment: organization-defined systems or system components].

nodes.name: Penetration Testing | Independent Penetration Testing Agent or Team
nodes.description: Employ an independent penetration testing agent or team to perform penetration testing on the system or system components.

nodes.name: Penetration Testing | Red Team Exercises
nodes.description: Employ the following red-team exercises to simulate attempts by adversaries to compromise organizational systems in accordance with applicable rules of engagement: [Assignment: organization-defined red team exercises].

nodes.name: Penetration Testing | Facility Penetration Testing
nodes.description:
Employ a penetration testing process that includes [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]
                  [Selection: announced; unannounced] attempts to bypass or circumvent controls associated with physical access points to the facility.

nodes.name: Internal System Connections
Internal System Connections | Compliance Checks
nodes.description: Perform security and privacy compliance checks on constituent system components prior to the establishment of the internal connection.

nodes.name: Policy and Procedures
nodes.description:
a. Develop, document, and disseminate to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]:

1. [Selection (one or more): Organization-level; Mission/business process-level; System-level] configuration management policy that:

(a) Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
(b) Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
2. Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the configuration management policy and the associated configuration management controls;
b. Designate an [Assignment: organization-defined official] to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the configuration management policy and procedures; and
c. Review and update the current configuration management:

1. Policy [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events]; and
2. Procedures [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events].

nodes.name: Baseline Configuration
nodes.description:
a. Develop, document, and maintain under configuration control, a current baseline configuration of the system; and
b. Review and update the baseline configuration of the system:

1. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency];
2. When required due to [Assignment: organization-defined circumstances]; and
3. When system components are installed or upgraded.

nodes.name: Baseline Configuration | Reviews and Updates
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CM-2.

nodes.name: Baseline Configuration | Automation Support for Accuracy and Currency
nodes.description: Maintain the currency, completeness, accuracy, and availability of the baseline configuration of the system using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nodes.name: Baseline Configuration | Retention of Previous Configurations
nodes.description: Retain [Assignment: organization-defined number] of previous versions of baseline configurations of the system to support rollback.

nodes.name: Baseline Configuration | Unauthorized Software
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CM-7(4).

nodes.name: Baseline Configuration | Authorized Software
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CM-7(5).

nodes.name: Baseline Configuration | Development and Test Environments
nodes.description: Maintain a baseline configuration for system development and test environments that is managed separately from the operational baseline configuration.

nodes.name: Baseline Configuration | Configure Systems and Components for High-risk Areas
nodes.description:
(a) Issue [Assignment: organization-defined systems or system components] with [Assignment: organization-defined configurations] to individuals traveling to locations that the organization deems to be of significant risk; and
(b) Apply the following controls to the systems or components when the individuals return from travel: [Assignment: organization-defined controls].

nodes.name: Configuration Change Control
Configuration Change Control | Automated Documentation, Notification, and Prohibition of Changes
Configuration Change Control | Testing, Validation, and Documentation of Changes
nodes.description: Test, validate, and document changes to the system before finalizing the implementation of the changes.

nodes.name: Configuration Change Control | Automated Change Implementation
nodes.description: Implement changes to the current system baseline and deploy the updated baseline across the installed base using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nodes.name: Configuration Change Control | Security and Privacy Representatives
nodes.description: Require [Assignment: organization-defined security and privacy representatives] to be members of the [Assignment: organization-defined configuration change control element].

nodes.name: Configuration Change Control | Automated Security Response
nodes.description: Implement the following security responses automatically if baseline configurations are changed in an unauthorized manner: [Assignment: organization-defined security responses].

nodes.name: Configuration Change Control | Cryptography Management
nodes.description: Ensure that cryptographic mechanisms used to provide the following controls are under configuration management: [Assignment: organization-defined controls].

nodes.name: Configuration Change Control | Review System Changes
nodes.description: Review changes to the system [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] or when [Assignment: organization-defined circumstances] to determine whether unauthorized changes have occurred.

nodes.name: Configuration Change Control | Prevent or Restrict Configuration Changes
nodes.description: Prevent or restrict changes to the configuration of the system under the following circumstances: [Assignment: organization-defined circumstances].

nodes.name: Impact Analyses
nodes.description: Analyze changes to the system to determine potential security and privacy impacts prior to change implementation.

nodes.name: Impact Analyses | Separate Test Environments
nodes.description: Analyze changes to the system in a separate test environment before implementation in an operational environment, looking for security and privacy impacts due to flaws, weaknesses, incompatibility, or intentional malice.

nodes.name: Impact Analyses | Verification of Controls
nodes.description: After system changes, verify that the impacted controls are implemented correctly, operating as intended, and producing the desired outcome with regard to meeting the security and privacy requirements for the system.

nodes.name: Access Restrictions for Change
nodes.description: Define, document, approve, and enforce physical and logical access restrictions associated with changes to the system.

nodes.name: Access Restrictions for Change | Automated Access Enforcement and Audit Records
nodes.description:
(a) Enforce access restrictions using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms]; and
(b) Automatically generate audit records of the enforcement actions.

nodes.name: Access Restrictions for Change | Review System Changes
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CM-3(7).

nodes.name: Access Restrictions for Change | Signed Components
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CM-14.

nodes.name: Access Restrictions for Change | Dual Authorization
nodes.description: Enforce dual authorization for implementing changes to [Assignment: organization-defined system components and system-level information].

nodes.name: Access Restrictions for Change | Privilege Limitation for Production and Operation
nodes.description:
(a) Limit privileges to change system components and system-related information within a production or operational environment; and
(b) Review and reevaluate privileges [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

nodes.name: Access Restrictions for Change | Limit Library Privileges
nodes.description: Limit privileges to change software resident within software libraries.

nodes.name: Access Restrictions for Change | Automatic Implementation of Security Safeguards
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SI-7.

nodes.name: Configuration Settings
Configuration Settings | Automated Management, Application, and Verification
nodes.description: Manage, apply, and verify configuration settings for [Assignment: organization-defined system components] using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nodes.name: Configuration Settings | Respond to Unauthorized Changes
nodes.description: Take the following actions in response to unauthorized changes to [Assignment: organization-defined configuration settings]: [Assignment: organization-defined actions].

nodes.name: Configuration Settings | Unauthorized Change Detection
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SI-7.

nodes.name: Configuration Settings | Conformance Demonstration
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CM-4.

nodes.name: Least Functionality
nodes.description:
a. Configure the system to provide only [Assignment: organization-defined mission essential capabilities]; and
b. Prohibit or restrict the use of the following functions, ports, protocols, software, and/or services: [Assignment: organization-defined prohibited or restricted functions, system ports, protocols, software, and/or services].

nodes.name: Least Functionality | Periodic Review
nodes.description:
(a) Review the system [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] to identify unnecessary and/or nonsecure functions, ports, protocols, software, and services; and
(b) Disable or remove [Assignment: organization-defined functions, ports, protocols, software, and services within the system deemed to be unnecessary and/or nonsecure].

nodes.name: Least Functionality | Prevent Program Execution
nodes.description: Prevent program execution in accordance with [Selection (one or more): [Assignment: organization-defined policies, rules of behavior, and/or access agreements regarding software program usage and restrictions]; rules authorizing the terms and conditions of software program usage].

nodes.name: Least Functionality | Registration Compliance
nodes.description: Ensure compliance with [Assignment: organization-defined registration requirements for functions, ports, protocols, and services].

nodes.name: Least Functionality | Unauthorized Software ��� Deny-by-exception
Least Functionality | Authorized Software ��� Allow-by-exception
Least Functionality | Confined Environments with Limited Privileges
nodes.description: Require that the following user-installed software execute in a confined physical or virtual machine environment with limited privileges: [Assignment: organization-defined user-installed software].

nodes.name: Least Functionality | Code Execution in Protected Environments
nodes.description:
Allow execution of binary or machine-executable code only in confined physical or virtual machine environments and with the explicit approval of [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] when such code is:

(a) Obtained from sources with limited or no warranty; and/or
(b) Without the provision of source code.

nodes.name: Least Functionality | Binary or Machine Executable Code
nodes.description:
(a) Prohibit the use of binary or machine-executable code from sources with limited or no warranty or without the provision of source code; and
(b) Allow exceptions only for compelling mission or operational requirements and with the approval of the authorizing official.

nodes.name: Least Functionality | Prohibiting The Use of Unauthorized Hardware
System Component Inventory
System Component Inventory | Updates During Installation and Removal
nodes.description: Update the inventory of system components as part of component installations, removals, and system updates.

nodes.name: System Component Inventory | Automated Maintenance
nodes.description: Maintain the currency, completeness, accuracy, and availability of the inventory of system components using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nodes.name: System Component Inventory | Automated Unauthorized Component Detection
nodes.description:
(a) Detect the presence of unauthorized hardware, software, and firmware components within the system using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms]
                     [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]; and
(b) Take the following actions when unauthorized components are detected: [Selection (one or more): disable network access by such components; isolate the components; notify [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]].

nodes.name: System Component Inventory | Accountability Information
nodes.description: Include in the system component inventory information, a means for identifying by [Selection (one or more): name; position; role], individuals responsible and accountable for administering those components.

nodes.name: System Component Inventory | No Duplicate Accounting of Components
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CM-8.

nodes.name: System Component Inventory | Assessed Configurations and Approved Deviations
nodes.description: Include assessed component configurations and any approved deviations to current deployed configurations in the system component inventory.

nodes.name: System Component Inventory | Centralized Repository
nodes.description: Provide a centralized repository for the inventory of system components.

nodes.name: System Component Inventory | Automated Location Tracking
nodes.description: Support the tracking of system components by geographic location using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nodes.name: System Component Inventory | Assignment of Components to Systems
nodes.description:
(a) Assign system components to a system; and
(b) Receive an acknowledgement from [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] of this assignment.

nodes.name: Configuration Management Plan
Configuration Management Plan | Assignment of Responsibility
nodes.description: Assign responsibility for developing the configuration management process to organizational personnel that are not directly involved in system development.

nodes.name: Software Usage Restrictions
Software Usage Restrictions | Open-source Software
nodes.description: Establish the following restrictions on the use of open-source software: [Assignment: organization-defined restrictions].

nodes.name: User-installed Software
User-installed Software | Alerts for Unauthorized Installations
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CM-8(3).

nodes.name: User-installed Software | Software Installation with Privileged Status
nodes.description: Allow user installation of software only with explicit privileged status.

nodes.name: User-installed Software | Automated Enforcement and Monitoring
nodes.description: Enforce and monitor compliance with software installation policies using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nodes.name: Information Location
Information Location | Automated Tools to Support Information Location
nodes.description: Use automated tools to identify [Assignment: organization-defined information by information type] on [Assignment: organization-defined system components] to ensure controls are in place to protect organizational information and individual privacy.

nodes.name: Data Action Mapping
nodes.description: Develop and document a map of system data actions.

nodes.name: Signed Components
nodes.description: Prevent the installation of [Assignment: organization-defined software and firmware components] without verification that the component has been digitally signed using a certificate that is recognized and approved by the organization.

nodes.name: Policy and Procedures
nodes.description:
a. Develop, document, and disseminate to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]:

1. [Selection (one or more): Organization-level; Mission/business process-level; System-level] contingency planning policy that:

(a) Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
(b) Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
2. Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the contingency planning policy and the associated contingency planning controls;
b. Designate an [Assignment: organization-defined official] to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the contingency planning policy and procedures; and
c. Review and update the current contingency planning:

1. Policy [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events]; and
2. Procedures [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events].

nodes.name: Contingency Plan
Contingency Plan | Coordinate with Related Plans
nodes.description: Coordinate contingency plan development with organizational elements responsible for related plans.

nodes.name: Contingency Plan | Capacity Planning
nodes.description: Conduct capacity planning so that necessary capacity for information processing, telecommunications, and environmental support exists during contingency operations.

nodes.name: Contingency Plan | Resume Mission and Business Functions
nodes.description: Plan for the resumption of [Selection: all; essential] mission and business functions within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] of contingency plan activation.

nodes.name: Contingency Plan | Resume All Mission and Business Functions
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CP-2(3).

nodes.name: Contingency Plan | Continue Mission and Business Functions
nodes.description: Plan for the continuance of [Selection: all; essential] mission and business functions with minimal or no loss of operational continuity and sustains that continuity until full system restoration at primary processing and/or storage sites.

nodes.name: Contingency Plan | Alternate Processing and Storage Sites
nodes.description: Plan for the transfer of [Selection: all; essential] mission and business functions to alternate processing and/or storage sites with minimal or no loss of operational continuity and sustain that continuity through system restoration to primary processing and/or storage sites.

nodes.name: Contingency Plan | Coordinate with External Service Providers
nodes.description: Coordinate the contingency plan with the contingency plans of external service providers to ensure that contingency requirements can be satisfied.

nodes.name: Contingency Plan | Identify Critical Assets
nodes.description: Identify critical system assets supporting [Selection: all; essential] mission and business functions.

nodes.name: Contingency Training
nodes.description:
a. Provide contingency training to system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities:

1. Within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] of assuming a contingency role or responsibility;
2. When required by system changes; and
3. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] thereafter; and
b. Review and update contingency training content [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events].

nodes.name: Contingency Training | Simulated Events
nodes.description: Incorporate simulated events into contingency training to facilitate effective response by personnel in crisis situations.

nodes.name: Contingency Training | Mechanisms Used in Training Environments
nodes.description: Employ mechanisms used in operations to provide a more thorough and realistic contingency training environment.

nodes.name: Contingency Plan Testing
nodes.description:
a. Test the contingency plan for the system [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] using  the following tests to determine the effectiveness of the plan and the readiness to execute the plan: [Assignment: organization-defined tests].
b. Review the contingency plan test results; and
c. Initiate corrective actions, if needed.

nodes.name: Contingency Plan Testing | Coordinate with Related Plans
nodes.description: Coordinate contingency plan testing with organizational elements responsible for related plans.

nodes.name: Contingency Plan Testing | Alternate Processing Site
nodes.description:
Test the contingency plan at the alternate processing site:

(a) To familiarize contingency personnel with the facility and available resources; and
(b) To evaluate the capabilities of the alternate processing site to support contingency operations.

nodes.name: Contingency Plan Testing | Automated Testing
nodes.description: Test the contingency plan using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nodes.name: Contingency Plan Testing | Full Recovery and Reconstitution
nodes.description: Include a full recovery and reconstitution of the system to a known state as part of contingency plan testing.

nodes.name: Contingency Plan Testing | Self-challenge
nodes.description: Employ [Assignment: organization-defined mechanisms] to [Assignment: organization-defined system or system component] to disrupt and adversely affect the system or system component.

nodes.name: Contingency Plan Update
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CP-2.

nodes.name: Alternate Storage Site
nodes.description:
a. Establish an alternate storage site, including necessary agreements to permit the storage and retrieval of system backup information; and
b. Ensure that the alternate storage site provides controls equivalent to that of the primary site.

nodes.name: Alternate Storage Site | Separation from Primary Site
nodes.description: Identify an alternate storage site that is sufficiently separated from the primary storage site to reduce susceptibility to the same threats.

nodes.name: Alternate Storage Site | Recovery Time and Recovery Point Objectives
nodes.description: Configure the alternate storage site to facilitate recovery operations in accordance with recovery time and recovery point objectives.

nodes.name: Alternate Storage Site | Accessibility
nodes.description: Identify potential accessibility problems to the alternate storage site in the event of an area-wide disruption or disaster and outline explicit mitigation actions.

nodes.name: Alternate Processing Site
Alternate Processing Site | Separation from Primary Site
nodes.description: Identify an alternate processing site that is sufficiently separated from the primary processing site to reduce susceptibility to the same threats.

nodes.name: Alternate Processing Site | Accessibility
nodes.description: Identify potential accessibility problems to alternate processing sites in the event of an area-wide disruption or disaster and outlines explicit mitigation actions.

nodes.name: Alternate Processing Site | Priority of Service
nodes.description: Develop alternate processing site agreements that contain priority-of-service provisions in accordance with availability requirements (including recovery time objectives).

nodes.name: Alternate Processing Site | Preparation for Use
nodes.description: Prepare the alternate processing site so that the site can serve as the operational site supporting essential mission and business functions.

nodes.name: Alternate Processing Site | Equivalent Information Security Safeguards
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CP-7.

nodes.name: Alternate Processing Site | Inability to Return to Primary Site
nodes.description: Plan and prepare for circumstances that preclude returning to the primary processing site.

nodes.name: Telecommunications Services
nodes.description: Establish alternate telecommunications services, including necessary agreements to permit the resumption of [Assignment: organization-defined system operations] for essential mission and business functions within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] when the primary telecommunications capabilities are unavailable at either the primary or alternate processing or storage sites.

nodes.name: Telecommunications Services | Priority of Service Provisions
nodes.description:
(a) Develop primary and alternate telecommunications service agreements that contain priority-of-service provisions in accordance with availability requirements (including recovery time objectives); and
(b) Request Telecommunications Service Priority for all telecommunications services used for national security emergency preparedness if the primary and/or alternate telecommunications services are provided by a common carrier.

nodes.name: Telecommunications Services | Single Points of Failure
nodes.description: Obtain alternate telecommunications services to reduce the likelihood of sharing a single point of failure with primary telecommunications services.

nodes.name: Telecommunications Services | Separation of Primary and Alternate Providers
nodes.description: Obtain alternate telecommunications services from providers that are separated from primary service providers to reduce susceptibility to the same threats.

nodes.name: Telecommunications Services | Provider Contingency Plan
Telecommunications Services | Alternate Telecommunication Service Testing
nodes.description: Test alternate telecommunication services [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

nodes.name: System Backup
System Backup | Testing for Reliability and Integrity
nodes.description: Test backup information [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] to verify media reliability and information integrity.

nodes.name: System Backup | Test Restoration Using Sampling
nodes.description: Use a sample of backup information in the restoration of selected system functions as part of contingency plan testing.

nodes.name: System Backup | Separate Storage for Critical Information
nodes.description: Store backup copies of [Assignment: organization-defined critical system software and other security-related information] in a separate facility or in a fire rated container that is not collocated with the operational system.

nodes.name: System Backup | Protection from Unauthorized Modification
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CP-9.

nodes.name: System Backup | Transfer to Alternate Storage Site
nodes.description: Transfer system backup information to the alternate storage site [Assignment: organization-defined time period and transfer rate consistent with the recovery time and recovery point objectives].

nodes.name: System Backup | Redundant Secondary System
nodes.description: Conduct system backup by maintaining a redundant secondary system that is not collocated with the primary system and that can be activated without loss of information or disruption to operations.

nodes.name: System Backup | Dual Authorization for Deletion or Destruction
nodes.description: Enforce dual authorization for the deletion or destruction of [Assignment: organization-defined backup information].

nodes.name: System Backup | Cryptographic Protection
nodes.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification of [Assignment: organization-defined backup information].

nodes.name: System Recovery and Reconstitution
nodes.description: Provide for the recovery and reconstitution of the system to a known state within [Assignment: organization-defined time period consistent with recovery time and recovery point objectives] after a disruption, compromise, or failure.

nodes.name: System Recovery and Reconstitution | Contingency Plan Testing
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into CP-4.

nodes.name: System Recovery and Reconstitution | Transaction Recovery
nodes.description: Implement transaction recovery for systems that are transaction-based.

nodes.name: System Recovery and Reconstitution | Compensating Security Controls
nodes.description: Withdrawn: Addressed through tailoring.
